title: Linux hwclock Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux hwclock command, learn how to synchronize system time with hardware clock, and adjust the hardware clock manually for effective system time management.

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Functionality of the hwclock Command

verify.name: Verify hardware clock time
verify.hint: The hardware clock time does not match the system time. Please ensure you have correctly synchronized the system time with the hardware clock using the `hwclock --systohc` command.

steps.title: Synchronize System Time with Hardware Clock

verify.name: Verify system time synchronization
verify.hint: The system time is not synchronized with the hardware clock. Please ensure you have correctly synchronized the system time using the `hwclock --systohc` command.

verify.name: Verify hardware clock adjustment
verify.hint: The hardware clock was not adjusted correctly. Please ensure you have used the `hwclock --set --date="2023-04-11 13:00:00"` command to manually set the hardware clock to the desired time.
